data.title: Wonderful experience from start to finish!
data.text: From the person who greeted us to our server and then the delicious food,we had a great experience! We had a party of 7 people. Everyone ordered different items. Started with bloomin' onion and assorted chicken,fish and steaks. NOONE had a complaint.

data.title: Very very slow service
data.text: I should not take an hour and half for 2 people from beginning to end to eat a meal.  Especially at roughly 4:15 for an early dinner.  Last 2 visits both had terrible service and workers seem to just not care.  This location has gone down hill and we won't be back anytime soon.

owner_response.author: OutbackGuestServices, Manager at Outback Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We're sorry we let you down. We'd like to review this further if you could please take a moment to send me an email at news@outback.com with the subject "TripAdvisor - Rochester Hills, MI". We can then correspond directly over email. 

Sincerely, 

Madeline
Outback Steakhouse
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Awful service
data.text: I visited here with my wife and in-laws for dinner, and we received awful service. Our server's tone and attitude showed he didn't care and didn't want to be there. We had to ask 3 times for drink refills! He never returned after our food arrived to check on our steaks. It's too bad, considering our steaks were all overcooked! The temperature and taste of the food wasn't bad at all, but it was an annoyance to have to continually ask for service and not receive any. We won't be coming back anytime soon!

owner_response.author: OutbackGuestServices, Guest Relations Manager at Outback Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi there,

This is not at all the food and service experience we had hoped for. Please take a moment to email us at news@outback.com with the subject: TripAdvisor Review – Store 2332 so we can follow up with you directly.

Thank you!

Leah
Outback Steakhouse
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good Team
data.text: My wife and I stopped in for lunch on Saturday June 25, 2016. We both ordered small sirloins. When they arrived, they were a little tough, but totally edible and very good. When asked about the food by Brooke, our server, my wife mentioned that the steak was a little tough, but OK. Brooke immediately offered to bring another steak for my wife, but she declined as she had already finished her meal. We were finishing our drinks when Jackie the manager appeared with a full meal in a to-go box. Her statement was that we could have it for dinner, but if the original steak was tough that it was unacceptable and needed to be replaced. We felt that Brooke by communicating with her manager, and Jackie, by replacing the meal went a long ways to build a better customer - client relationship. More business' should be this good.

data.title: OK
data.text: I have never been a huge fan of Outback because I never love my meal here. My husband doesn't mind it. It depends on your taste.  The best thing is the onion ring app

data.title: Worst of the Worst
data.text:
What can I say?  Nothing was good about our experience on Tuesday night (3-8-16).
We had three adults and two children in our party and arrived around 5:50 pm and were promptly seated (there were only two tables occupied). Our table was dirty and sticky.  The hostess said she would clean it & began smearing the table with a paper towel. She never bothered to really clean it and most of the crumbs were just pushed onto our chairs. We waited approx. 5 minutes for our waitress to take our drink orders and offer bread.

It was another 5 minute wait to get our drinks and bread............another 10 minute wait and we had to locate the waitress & ask her if we could place our order.  After placing our orders and eating the loaf of bread we watched other tables filling up and already having there dinners served, although we were there 1/2 hour before them.

Again I had to ask another employee where our waitress was. When she finally showed up, she said "I will be right back." By this time we had been there over 45 minutes and hadn't been served and other tables were finishing up and asking for their bills.

When our food finally showed up: both the sirloins we ordered medium were a totally dried out and tasteless well done.  The grandsons grilled cheese was served on a dried out piece of bread.......did not resemble a grilled cheese sandwich.

Overall bad service........I feel from the hostess............to the cook.............to the waitress............to the franchise owner, nobody cares.  And of course this was the first time at any Outback I have ever eaten, that anybody cared to ask about our meals or the service.

This location is less than Mediocre and we will not be back.  We will stick to the Schoenherr and Hall Rd. Location.

data.title: Bad time
data.text: Horrible...horrible service.  One steak came out the size of a small hamburger! We wait over a half hour to get our salads and that was after complaining to the owner.  We had to continue to ask for items we already asked for!

data.title: Needs updating
data.text: Bread warm and tasty, bacon-cheese hamburger on toasted bun good, French Onion soup average with large thick circle of cheese on top which I thought strange. Coconut shrimp and baked potato good. Staff friendly, attentive and considerate. The restuarant needs a face-lift in my opinion and seems a little dark although it is neat and clean. Time from ordering to being served our food seemed too long.

data.title: Good Place for a Steak
data.text: This chain is a cut above the other steak house in consistence and price.  It is not an inexpensive place to eat, but it is better than the other chain steak restaurants.  The staff is friendly and the food is always good.  My wife has a restrictive diet and has to eat plain.  Most of the time they get it right, but when there is a problem, the staff takes care of it right away without question.  The customer is always right.

data.title: Excellent Allergy Customer Service
data.text: We can't fault Outback, the food is great and call ahead seating is very helpful.  Staff were incredibly friendly and both Brooke and Victoria gave top notch customer service.  Attention to detail with food allergies was outstanding - Thank you so much!!!!!

data.title: Very disappointed with my meal.
data.text:
The loaf of bread-delicous. The wait staff was friendly. 
Had the French Onion Soup, Tomato, Basil, Mozzerella Capriess Salad and Coconut Shrimp, which I felt was all overpriced for the amout given. The Provolone cheese on top of the onion soup wasn't broiled/browned long enough. The soup was tasty, though.
How could one go wrong with the salad? Outback proved it could! No fresh basil. No flavor to the tomatoes and they are in season!    For some reason OB felt adding sugar would make this simple salad tastier, NOT.  A little salt and pepper would have been fine.
I love shrimp, just not theirs! For $9.49, I think one should get more than four small shrimp or use Jumbo! Also, the use of added sugar made the cocnut batter too sweet that I had to peel it off. 
So disappointed that I will not return.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Nothing exciting , but good fresh cooked food, nice steaks and burger, in normal pricing, friendly and fast service, got a good made burger, and fresh salad. It's ok for standard Dinner.

data.title: Good food, friendly service
data.text: Just here 4/27/15. Ribeye Steak, chicken, pork chops all good. Substituted soup for fries without a problem. Food prompt, hot. Husband forgot to tell waitress no spices on steak and when they brought it out, he remembered. They promptly brought him a completely new dinner. Free dessert for the birthday person which we all shared as it was a lot. Waitress, Alyssa, was great, very attentive. The only bad thing I can say is that they ran out of crayons the day before so our little grandson had to "color" with a pen!

data.title: Let down
data.text: I went there with my family of 4 at around 2:30 pm on the weekend.  Out waitress was slow and was not friendly.  We felt more of an inconvenience than a valued customer.  I had the Outback burger.  It was uninspiring and presented poorly.  All it had was mustard on it.  We had to ask for everything because nothing was offered like basic condiments.  Our food was not hot, but close to room temperature too.  The interior looks very dated.  The ceiling was office like drop ceilings that was painted purple.  ONE, good point was the hostess.  She was the highlight, very friendly and welcoming....too bad the restaurant and waitress was less than stellar.  We won't be back.

data.title: Go to Outback on Hall Road Instead
data.text: We came here only because we were in the area.  We should have gone to the Outback on Hall Road.  The only thing good about this place was the call ahead seating.  After that it was all downhill.  Service was slow beyond belief and the food had to be sent back because it was overcooked (medium was ordered;  steaks came out well done).  All in all we ended up spending about three hours here and had a terrible experience.  Management should go to the Hall Road store and learn how it is done.

data.title: Good lunch
data.text: Had lunch here and the food was good. Service was decent. I am disappointed that the server didn't mention dine-rewards however. Ended up kind of expensive for lunch, but we don't often have lunch at a restaurant.

data.title: Food okay, service not great
data.text: We went for dinner on Friday night before the holiday weekend.  The restaurant wasn't super busy and we were seated within a few minutes and greeted promptly.  Orders were taken in a timely manner but then my mother-in-law's soup arrived cold.  Our dinners arrived before the soup was replaced.  Drink and bread refills had to be asked for and were slow in coming and so was the 2nd serving of shrimp we asked for.  I've been to much better Outback locations.

data.title: Don't waste your time!
data.text: I have been to many outback steakhouse locations and have NEVER experienced such a lack of care for the food and service. Don't even expect to get a carry out from here because curbside to-go doesn't even answer the phone. Steak was suppose to be medium-rare and was well done. Sautéed mushrooms were cold and the bread had no flavor. Do yourself a favor and don't waste your time! The management clearly doesn't know how to run a restaurant

data.title: Never again!
data.text: Service started slow but tolerable. Food was the worst ever! Strip steak stringy, chewy, grilled only on one side and tasteless. Chicken on the cob salad was totally RAW. I am not sure how they missed it since they sliced it and put it on top of the dish. Coconut shrimp was fine. I will never go back and will not recommend this place. Lack of care and indifference was evident throughout our meal.

data.title: Worst Steakhouse
data.text: Service was very slow, our waiter kept forgetting to bring us bread and water, we had to remind him multiple times.  One order had to be returned to the kitchen because the steak was overcooked.  It was supposed to be tenderloin with unlimited shrimp, both were terrible.  The steak was chemically tenderized, it had no taste.  The shrimp, forget it....pity looking shrimp, maybe four or five tiny ones in a small cup, definitely did not look the same as what they advertised.  The herb roasted prime rib was mushy and tasteless, and the sweet potato fries were all soggy.  Definitely would not go back, diners beware!
